de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcomparser.xml

Class DataObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcomparser.xml.DataObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPersistable

    public class DataObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPersistable
    This class represents a DataObject. A DataObject is an entity which is shown inside the Scenario and represented by one or more DataNodes inside all of the Fragments.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataObject()
      Creates a new DataObject without a given dataClass.
      DataObject(DataClass dataClass)
      Creates a new DataObject with a given dataClass.

      Returns the databaseID of the initial State.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataObject

        public DataObject(DataClass dataClass)
        Creates a new DataObject with a given dataClass.

        dataClass - The dataClass the dataObject belongs to

      • DataObject

        public DataObject()
        Creates a new DataObject without a given dataClass.

    • Method Detail

      • addDataNode

        public void addDataNode(Node dataNode)
        Adds a new dataNode to the dataObject. If the state has not been written to the database it will be added
        Parameters:
        dataNode - the new node which will be added

      • save

        public int save()
        Description copied from interface: IPersistable
        Writes the data from the object to the database. The id will be returned.
        Specified by:
        save in interface IPersistable
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created entry

      • setScenarioId

        public void setScenarioId(int newScenarioId)
        Sets the scenario id.
        Parameters:
        newScenarioId - Should be the database Id of the Scenario.

      • getDataNodes

        public java.util.List<Node> getDataNodes()
        Returns the list of dataNodes. Be aware that it is no copy. (It is more a composition than an aggregation. This means, if you change the list you change the dataObject)
        Returns:
        the list of DataNodes inside the DataObject

      • getInitState

        public java.lang.Integer getInitState()
        Returns the databaseID of the initial State. (We assume that the initial State is ("init").
        Returns:
        the databaseId of the state "init".

      • getDatabaseId

        public int getDatabaseId()
        Returns the database id.
        Returns:
        the id (int) which is primary key inside the database.

      • getStates

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getStates()
        Returns the map of states. The map contains all states with their name (key) and their Id (value). Any changes will affect the state of the DataObject.
        Returns:
        the map of states.
